text: The greatest gift you can give your child is your time and attention.
author: Unknown

text: Children are not things to be molded, but people to be unfolded.
author: Jess Lair

text: Your children need your presence more than your presents.
author: Jesse Jackson

text: Every day, in every way, you are shaping a future leader.
The best thing a parent can do is believe in their child's potential.
Parenting is the one job where the more you put in, the more you get back.
Behind every young child who believes in themselves is a parent who believed first.
author: Matthew Jacobson

text: Your involvement in your child's education is the greatest predictor of their success.
A parent's love is the fuel that enables a normal human being to do the impossible.
author: Marion C. Garretty

text: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
author: W.B. Yeats

text: The way we talk to our children becomes their inner voice.
author: Peggy O'Mara

text: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
author: W.E.B. Du Bois

text: You are your child's first and most important teacher.
Encourage your child's curiosity — it's the engine of achievement.
Every expert was once a beginner. Your child's journey starts with your support.
The more you read to your children, the more things they will know.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Patience is the companion of wisdom in parenting.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Let your children see you learning — it teaches them that growth never stops.
A family that learns together grows together.
Your encouragement today is the confidence your child carries tomorrow.
It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken adults.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: The best inheritance a parent can give their children is a few minutes of their time each day.
author: O.A. Battista

text: There is no such thing as a perfect parent, but a million ways to be a great one.
What we instill in our children will be the foundation upon which they build their future.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Don't worry that children never listen to you; worry that they are always watching you.
author: Robert Fulghum

text: Your child's success in school starts with the support they receive at home.
The greatest legacy we can leave our children is happy memories.
author: Og Mandino

text: Praise your child's effort, not just results — that's how resilience is built.
Raising children is like gardening: patience, consistency, and love always bear fruit.
A parent's consistent presence speaks louder than a thousand words of advice.
The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore Hesburgh

text: When you teach your child something, you teach their children too.
Kids don't remember their best day of television. They remember the time you spent with them.
Trust the process — learning doesn't always happen on schedule, and that's okay.
Celebrate small victories. Every step forward is progress worth recognizing.
Your calm is contagious. When you handle challenges with grace, your children learn to do the same.
Connection before correction — a child who feels heard is a child who learns.
The family is the first school of human virtues.
author: Pope John Paul II

text: Being a parent means loving your children more than you've ever loved yourself.
